document.masterDocTitle: A new genus of Cranaidae from Ecuador (Opiliones: Laniatores)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new genus of Cranaidae from Ecuador (Opiliones: Laniatores)

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. Neo-latinization of Ecuadorian Spanish “morlaco” (a native of Azuay), emphasizing this as the first reported species of Opiliones from Azuay province.

Type data.
3 holotype ( QCAZ AK 0029) Ecuador , Azuay, Molleturo, alt: 3210 m (
79 º 20.426 ’ W
,
02º 48.221 ’ S
)
27 .xii. 2001
, I. Tapia & G. Onore leg.
Description : male holotype . Measurements of body: CL = 2.9 , CW = 4.0, AL = 4.3 , AW = 6.1 .

Venter (
Fig. 25
).
Coxae I–III fine granular, transverse parallel, subequal in size, touching in midline. Coxa IV much more robust than any of the others, clearly slanted. Stigmatic area Y-shaped, with large unobstructed elliptical stigmata. Coxa IV ventro-distally with pair of acuminate tubercles. Genital opercle elliptical, truncated posteriorly.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 21–23.
Zannicranaus morlacus
sp. nov.
3 holotype, QCAZ AK 0 0 29, from Molleturo. 21. Habitus, dorsal view; 22. Body, lateral view; 23. Body, dorsal view. Scale bars = 1 mm. Abbreviation: co = coda.

FIGURES 24–25.
Zannicranaus morlacus
sp. nov.
3 holotype, QCAZ AK 0 0 29, from Molleturo. 24. Body, frontal view; 25. Body, ventral view. Scale bars = 1 mm.

FIGURES 26–29.
Zannicranaus morlacus
sp. nov.
3 holotype, QCAZ AK 0 0 29, from Molleturo. Right pedipalpus: 26. Dorso-mesal view; 27. Mesal view; 28. Ectal view; 29. Dorso-ectal view. Scale bars = 1 mm.

FIGURES 30–32.
Zannicranaus morlacus
sp. nov.
3 holotype, QCAZ AK 0 0 29, from Molleturo. Right pedipalpus: 30. Trochanter-femur, ventral view; 31. Patella-tarsus, ventral view; 32. Trochanter-femur, dorsal view. Scale bars = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pedipalpus (
Figs. 26–32
).
Trochanter with 3 unequal ventral and 1 large dorsal spines. Femur with 1 ectal row of 6 subequal tubercles; 1 mesal row of 5 tubercles; 1 dorsal row of 4 spines and 1 ventral row of 3 powerful spines. Patella and tibia dorsally with scattered short tubercles. Tibia ventro-ectal with 4 (IiIi), ventro-mesal with 6 (IiiiIi) spines. Tarsus ventro-ectal with 3 , ventro-mesal with 3 spines. Article measurements: Tr = 1.3 , Fe = 3.0, Pa = 1.6 , Ti = 2.5 , Ta = 2.2 , claw = 1.5 .

Legs. All leg articles unarmed except femur and tibia IV. Femur IV with 1 ventral subdistal spine, 2 prolateral spines. Tibia IV with a row of 7 spines, running obliquely from retrolateral to ventral. Calcaneus I twice as long as astragalus and a little thickened, astragalus with 3 rings. Metatarsus II–III each with 12 rings, IV with 23 rings. Tarsal counts 7 ( 3 )- 7 ( 3 )/ 13 ( 3 )- 12 ( 3 )/ 7 - 7 / 8 - 8 . Measurements of legs in
Table 1
.
Color (in alcohol). Body and appendages uniform Brownish Orange ( 54 ). Legs, posterior part of lateral bor- der of scutum and free tergites/sternites darker shaded.
